description: Unique user ID used to log in and identify the account across the system.
Primary email address for the account, used for contact and notifications.
Start of the user’s in-service/effective period for system access; likely employment or availability start. Confirm with SME.
End of the user’s in-service/effective period for system access; likely employment or availability end. Confirm with SME.
Timestamp when the user last changed their password.
Date the account automatically expires if not renewed.
Complete display name for the user.
Flag requiring the user to change password at next sign-in.
Most recent prior password (stored as hash) to prevent reuse; confirm with SME.
Second most recent prior password (stored as hash) to prevent reuse; confirm with SME.
Third most recent prior password (stored as hash) to prevent reuse; confirm with SME.
Security/authentication domains this user belongs to or may authenticate against; confirm with SME.
Identifier linking the user to a specific labor craft/technician profile; confirm with SME.
Access control policy effective start date for this user; confirm with SME.
Access control policy effective end date for this user; confirm with SME.
Indicates whether the user is enrolled for electronic signature.
Name/label of the user’s electronic signature as displayed on approvals.
Date the user enrolled for electronic signature.
Likely backup PIN/password or biometric credential used for approvals; confirm with SME.
Mobile phone number for contacting the user.
Direct permissions explicitly assigned to the user (before role inheritance).
Effective permissions after combining direct rights, roles, and group inheritance.
User or process that created the account record.
Date and time the account record was created.
User or process that last updated the account record.
Date and time the account record was last updated.
Indicates whether the account is active and permitted to sign in.
Default management unit/organization context applied to the user; confirm with SME.
Asset categories the user is permitted to view or work with; confirm with SME.
Preference to receive system notifications via text/SMS.
Preference to receive notifications via internal email.
Preference to receive notifications via external email.
Automatic signature block appended to emails sent by the system for this user.
Workgroup/team the user belongs to.
Default storeroom/warehouse associated with the user for inventory transactions.
Identifier of the user’s supervisor within the system.
Preference to display batch-processing pages or lists; confirm with SME.
Preferred color theme for the application (often mobile).
Preference to remember the last Work Order screen/filter state between sessions (mobile).
Preference to display inventory batch screens or lists.
Preference to display purchase order batch screens or lists.
Mobile data access level or scope (e.g., offline sync vs online); confirm with SME.
Labor trade/specialty associated with the user (e.g., mechanic, electrician).
Standard work hours used for scheduling or labor costing; confirm unit (daily/weekly) with SME.
Standard hourly labor rate for this user’s craft.
Internal/charge-out labor rate used on invoices or internal billing; confirm definition with SME.
User-defined field for additional craft-related information; meaning set by business configuration.
User-defined field for additional craft-related information; meaning set by business configuration.
User-defined field for additional craft-related information; meaning set by business configuration.
User-defined field for additional craft-related information; meaning set by business configuration.
User-defined field for additional craft-related information; meaning set by business configuration.
Indicates the user is authorized to perform inspections.
Indicates the user has approval authority for workflows or transactions.
Indicates the user is a labor resource/craft worker.
Associated vendor identifier when the user represents or is linked to an external vendor.
Reference to documents or media attached to the user profile; confirm with SME.
Indicates the user is designated as a driver.
Indicates whether two-factor authentication is required for this account.
Seed, backup code, or credential used for two-factor authentication; confirm storage purpose with SME.
Date/time two-factor credentials were issued or activated.
Planning or work program year associated with this user; confirm with SME.
Count of consecutive failed sign-in attempts.
Serialized mobile app settings and preferences specific to this user.
Indicates whether the user may modify their notification rules.
Identifier of the user’s current or last Single Sign-On session.
Indicates the account authenticates via Single Sign-On rather than local credentials; confirm with SME.
Code indicating the most recent authentication method (e.g., database, SSO, domain).
Indicates whether the user may edit their own profile details.
Flag or reference indicating the user is a crew leader or their assigned leader; confirm with SME.
Department identifier the user belongs to.
Employment or assignment start date.
Employment or assignment end date.
Name of the user’s primary emergency contact.
Work/office phone number.
Driver’s license or professional license number.
Expiration date of the recorded license.
Notes or codes indicating immunization status; confirm coding with SME.
Employee badge or access card number.
Free-text notes field for additional user information.
Additional free-text notes field for user information.
Recorded gender for the user, for HR or reporting purposes.
Allergy information for safety or medical reporting.
Date of birth.
Primary street address.
Secondary address line (apartment, suite, etc.).
City of the user’s address.
State/province of the address.
Postal/ZIP code of the address.
Phone number for the emergency contact.
Personal mobile phone number.
Relationship of the emergency contact to the user.
Given name.
Family/surname.
Job title or position.
Indicates whether the user can be assigned to work orders or tasks.
Indicates whether the user can act as a supervisor on work.
Indicates whether the user can act as a crew leader.
Default printer associated with the user.
Default labor identifier to prefill on LEM (Labor/Equipment/Materials) entries; confirm with SME.
Username used when authenticating via Single Sign-On.
Default value to prefill for LEM labor (field 'm'); likely minutes or Monday hours. Confirm with SME.
Default value to prefill for LEM labor (field 'd'); likely daily hours. Confirm with SME.
Preference to enable live online search within the mobile app.
